title: plaidypus’s author page
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:laruetheme]]


[[module CSS]]
    .rmposttitle {
        width: auto;
        height: auto;
        padding: 0px 20px 0px 20px;
    }

[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]
hi folks, and welcome to my author page. i am a: a tech-illiterate redneck, and b: don’t really give a shit as long as this thing functions[[footnote]] sorry if you were hoping i’d hurt your eyes with some terrible theme i made, this one was made by the talented [http://www.scp-wiki.wikidot.com/malycegraves-author MalyceGraves][[/footnote]], so there’s just a listpages table i stole from [http://www.scp-wiki.wikidot.com/gee0765-s-author-page gee0765's author page], some commentary i’ll add later, some sick rock and bluegrass songs you should listen to[[footnote]] if you want. i’m not your mom, that’s your mom’s job [[/footnote]], and also my dog, because she’s a dog and that’s pretty cute. 

------

[[collapsible show="+ Thank you" hide="- Thank you"]]
Just over 2 years ago at the time I'm writing this, I was a //terrible// writer.  However, more importantly, I was a terrible person, and terribly repressed. If I hadn't found this community when I did, and if it hadn't been as kind and corrective as it was, I simply would not be where I am now as a person and a writer. I've been able to understand that I'm pansexual and genderfluid, and been able to realize that the propaganda I've been fed about how happily being those things is sinful and depraved wasn't true. I'm a happier person as a direct result of this community's openness, acceptance, and willingness to give second chances. 

So, thank you all, and please consider keeping in mind the impact the culture that's been built here can have, and work to preserve and improve it.
[[/collapsible]] 

------

[[tab If I leave]]
Should I for some reason be completely absent from the wiki and IRC for more than a year,  [[*user MalyceGraves]] is allowed to make any edits to my work that they find necessary, and full purview of my co-authored work goes to its respective co-authors. [[*user MalyceGraves]] would also have absolute thematic purview over the La Rue Macabre hub.
[[/tab]]
